WRITING.TEXT: Hi all, I'm Jodie and I'm a children's illustrator from the UK. My Etsy shop is [Jodie Christine Illustrations](https://www.etsy.com/uk/shop/JodieChristineCox) and I sell a bunch of cute cards, postcards, badges, keyrings and gift tags! I also sell my zine: [How To Adult](https://www.etsy.com/uk/listing/604087192/how-to-adult-advice-zine-budgeting?ref=shop_home_active_9), which has tips for 16-25 year olds on how to do adult things like voting, cooking and budgeting. #8203; Check out my Etsy shop: [Jodie Christine Illustrations](https://www.etsy.com/uk/shop/JodieChristineCox) Facebook: [@JodieChristineIllustrations](https://www.facebook.com/jodiechristineillustrations) Twitter: [@subject2376](https://twitter.com/subject2376) Instagram: [@jodiechristinecox](https://www.instagram.com/jodiechristinecox/)

WRITING.TITLE: How To Adult
WRITING.TEXT: \*\*\*[HOW TO ADULT](https://www.etsy.com/uk/listing/604087192/how-to-adult-advice-zine-budgeting?ref=shop_home_active_9)\*\*\* is an advice zine for 16-25 year olds, with tips on how to do lots of things. There are pages on Voting, Budgeting, Cooking, First Aid and loads more. [Buy on my Etsy today](https://www.etsy.com/uk/shop/JodieChristineCox)! https://preview.redd.it/s17pr45sl3u11.jpg?width=4032 amp;format=pjpg amp;auto=webp amp;s=17e48545d1dc11631ef9eea4d06b3a3f30c3dc00 https://preview.redd.it/95wn4d5sl3u11.jpg?width=4032 amp;format=pjpg amp;auto=webp amp;s=0a12d17a5282085e0e7c86993991888fec5652dd https://preview.redd.it/u0prk75sl3u11.jpg?width=4032 amp;format=pjpg amp;auto=webp amp;s=c0273de330b8e08cb6e3f561ab2b13f6fdb2af54
Potentially! Send me your social media stuff and I'll take a look?
Looks great, but too spooky for me! Do you have an Instagram/Twitter? I'll give you a follow :)

WRITING.TEXT: I love your photos! I'd post on all of the social medias and promote the hell out of your shop! I find some Facebook groups work well to advertise my work.
My zines worked well in scouting groups. But try local groups on Facebook or gift and craft groups?

That's roughly what I take to fairs etc! If you're outside you probably will want some other lights too. I generally take some emergency fixing things - BluTac, Sticky Tape, Safety Pins, Pegs, Surface Wipes, String, Scissors, Pens etc. When I first started, I made note of everything I sold, which meant I could make sure that the money was right. I use Izettle now, which has all my products on and it even works out how much change to give :) Good Luck!
Becky Chambers is great for world building, I loved The Long Way To A Small Angry Planet!
I print my business cards and greeting cards with [Printed.com](https://Printed.com) \- always great service and quick delivery
Wow! Awesome!

WRITING.TITLE: How do you get people to buy?
WRITING.TEXT: I have had an Etsy shop for 2 years and in that time I've made 79 sales. Those sales are because of a zine I've made, which sold very well to scout leaders on a Facebook group. How do I encourage people to buy any of my items? Etsy Shop: [https://www.etsy.com/uk/shop/JodieChristineCox](https://www.etsy.com/uk/shop/JodieChristineCox)

WRITING.TITLE: How To Adult advice zine available on my Etsy shop!
WRITING.TEXT: Being an adult is weird, believe me, I know - I am a self-employed adult who really should know more about being an adult than I do. This zine is a collection of things that I've learnt while at university, while living with parents and while trying to work from home. How To Adult is a 24 page, colour-illustrated A5 zine with advice for the modern young adult. This zine is aimed at ages 16-25, but feel free to read it regardless of your age. With pages on subjects such as health, cooking, voting and friendships, this zine would be the perfect birthday gift, graduation gift or gift for yourself. Buy here: [https://www.etsy.com/uk/listing/604087192/how-to-adult-advice-zine-budgeting?ref=shop\_home\_active\_7](https://www.etsy.com/uk/listing/604087192/how-to-adult-advice-zine-budgeting?ref=shop_home_active_7)
That was so helpful #128522; thank you

As an illustrator, I have a basic understanding of anatomy etc, but I couldn't draw with realism. I tend to stylise characters. But in terms of 'great' artists, what do you define as great? Sure, the artists that make traditional paintings in galleries would have a lot of basis in realism, but if you take a look at more modern art, they don't always need it. I hope that made sense!

WRITING.TEXT: I sell cards and papergoods at fairs, but I always make sure I have a tablecloth, price tags and a way to note down what sales I make. I also bring a box/bag of emergency supplies - safety pins, string, tape, scissors/knife, pens, plain paper, blue tack, pegs etc. I especially find clothes pegs useful if I'm outside, you can use them to peg stuff to string for displays, but also to weigh things down so they don't blow away. If you want people to touch your items but not to break them, maybe have a sign that says "feel free to touch, but please be careful" or something similar? I use the app IZettle to keep track of sales I make. It keeps track of all sales and it even works out change if you need it to. Last tip - Talk to everyone you can. Say hi to anyone walking past, complement their shoes or dress, ask them an open-ended question, do anything you can to get them to look at your stall and you will be more likely to make a sale. Hope they helped! I've been doing markets monthly for about a year now and they are reasonably successful, just need some more foot traffic. Best of luck with the show
Thanks! Hoping to finish by the end of summer

I had so much trouble with this last week! I only have one or two of each design out and I make sure to blue tack them down to the tablecloths (tablecloths are wipe-clean ones, so things stick to them) I have some card stands for my greetings cards, and just make sure to not use the top shelf otherwise its like dominoes!
Thank you! Will try to post here when it's finished :)
Yeah, on IZettle you can put all your products on it and it keeps records. I'd definitely take a look at it! Good luck with the market!
I dont understand what this comment means. I was just sharing what I'm working on right now
Oh I see
This is my second zine, based on self care. Written by me and any illustrations in the zine are done my be too. All text and design done on InDesign

Definitely would work! There are 6 fruits in the game, if you go to a nook miles island, you can find your 'sister fruit' and coconuts

So you have your native fruit, which you'll find on your island as well as nook miles islands. But sometimes you'll find a different fruit on nook miles islands - this is your sister fruit. So my native fruit is pears, but I can also find peaches on islands

You could also look into board games, theyre something you could do with friends and you could join a local board game club or visit a board game cafe if they exist near you

WRITING.TEXT: Do you have the recipe for medicine? Otherwise just deal with wasp stings. They'll be gone in the morning. The worst thing that happens is you'll faint if you get stung when you've already got stings on your face, but that just sends you back to your house basically
Also. If you stand in front of trees, holding a net when you shake them, the nest will fall and your character will turn to face them. All you have to do then is mash A

So they have catchphrases and they have greetings for you. Catchphrases they should use most times you talk to them, greetings are just occasionally when you speak to them, instead of them saying Hi. If they are using another villager's Catchphrase, it'll be because they talked to another villager and picked up their one. All I can suggest is that you change all of your villagers catchphrases or that you keep changing the ones you want when you can
You can interact, the water and the duck does a little wobble

I really enjoyed The Long Way to a Small Angry Planet by Becky Chambers - a spacey book with lots of world building. Also I'm getting into graphic novels and poetry, as they are easier for me to read. For graphic novels, I'd suggest Giant Days and for poetry I'd suggest anything by Amanda Lovelace!

When I shared a house with my friends, we all used our own stuff. But we had a little pot that we all put the same amount of money in, this covered buying toilet rolls and cleaning supplies for whoever bought them! Then anything we had left went towards our end of year barbeque
I have my museum up there, with some picnic areas, little walk-through parks and a stargazing spot! Dream address is DA-3209-3201-2738 if you want to take a look

Turnips - buy from Daisy Mae on a Sunday morning (before 12) ideally you want to buy for under 100 bells. I use a turnip tracker to track the prices of turnips in my shop and predict good prices. Any price that is higher than your original buying price is good, but ideally sell for 200-300 (if you get lucky you might find someone who has their island open with turnips being bought for up to 600). Also apps - if you have nintendo online, get the mobile app too. It has a keyboard for typing on animal crossing, which makes talking to people in-game so much easier!

Make sure you have decorations, paths, fences, flowers and trees across your whole island, dont just leave one section without anything in. Also more than 14 items that have been dropped will stop you getting 5 stars. My island is 5 stars if you want to check it out: DA-3209-3201-2738
What sort of designs are you looking for?
Like areas on your island? Or clothes? Or paths?

Ah! You could make an autumn/spring themed line of clothes (depending on the season you are in) or you could make some Halloween ones. You could find a character you like and try to replicate their outfits, or you could look on clothing websites and make clothes like ones you like!
I have no suggestions for you then #128514;
You don't need to water if its been raining #128522; have you tried getting other people to water too?

I believe if they live on your island it doesn't work as an additional water. Do you have nintendo online and do you have any friends that play? If someone from another island comes to water, you get a lot more spawns
Oh!! Very strange!
Yeah!! They're a bit more awkward though. I've got some near my secret beach if you wanna take a look: DA-3209-3201-2738
I have the skull, chest, pelvis and tail spare, dm if you want them!

I met my boyfriend at uni at 18, have been dating since then (now 25). I don't regret a thing and we fully intend to spend the rest of our lives together. Hoping to move to a new city together this year

Usually 15 - 30 minutes, but my doctors surgery is 45 mins away and I dont have the patience to wait for a bus. I guess it depends how long I'll be there too? I'm happy to walk 15 minutes to the swimming pool, as I'm going to spend over an hour there.
